column4: The PowerPC CPU was made by the AIM alliance, Apple, IBM, and Motorola. this fact is evident as originally the PowerPC logo was copyrighted by Motorola.
All older PPC chips have a motorola logo on them... can't say bout the newer ones
yea there was a ppc but not apple
Apple still had a hand in it's design. Or are you stating that wikipedia is wrong?
yea it maybe b/c i believe there is still like an old world mac company but doesnt use mac os
i have a ppc i want to put linux on, but it's an old ppc chip (1 with motorola logo instead of IBM)
old world, i guess... it's a 603e @ 100Mhz
then i sugesst gentoo or debian| ubuntu doesnt currently use old world
